newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's six-month bills seen stable at auction.
newsitem.headline: Spain's six-month bills seen stable at auction.

text.p: After a steady decline in recent months, the yield on Spanish six-month Treasury bills may remain stable at an auction on Wednesday, dealers said on Tuesday.
The yield is likely to come out between 5.35 percent and 5.40, little different from 5.342 percent, an all-time record low from the last auction on January 15.
"Short-term deposit rates were increasing a bit in recent days and T-bills were attracting less interest," a money market dealer in Madrid said.

Other dealers, noting that one-year bills yields are lower than those on six-month paper, added that the Spanish Treasury could decide to allocate fewer six-month bills in favour of a bigger allocation on the one-year tranche.
At their latest auction one-year bills showed a minimum yield at 5.0542 pct.
"We don't have to forget that the Spanish Treasury is in a very good situation..and do not think they will make their debt more expensive," he said.
